meanings.definition: The act or process of vomiting.
meanings.sent1: After feeling sick, she experienced emesis in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The emesis was sudden and unexpected, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent3: The emesis during the roller coaster ride was definitely not part of the thrill.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety felt like a constant emesis of worries churning in his stomach.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the emesis lingered in the room long after the incident.

meanings.sent1: The nurse cleaned up the emesis from the hospital bed.
meanings.sent2: The emesis was a mix of food and bile, indicating a stomach issue.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed quite proud of the emesis it left on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The emesis looked like a colorful abstract painting on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The emesis splattered on the floor, creating a disgusting mess to clean up.
